intro: Sideritis phleoides, commonly known as the Greek violet or mountain violet, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants known for their medicinal properties. The plant features slender, erect stems and small, violet-blue flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Sideritis phleoides is valued for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of essential oils.
